result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Hutchens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended.

AODA and follow up.

DNA sample

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Reduce any financial obligations to be part of the supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Hutchens

Case Called: 11:01 a.m.

VRCW.

Atty Roehr in agreement, makes statement.
All parties have received the revocation packet and have no corrections. 

COURT ORDERS: CT 1: 3 years and 3 months in WSPS: 1 year 3 months initial confinement; 2 years E.S. 70 days credit. To run concurrent to any/all sentences; CIP/SAP; Reduce any financial obligations to be part of the supervision.

Jury Trial going for Judge O'Neill tomorrow; SAR to be heard by Judge Cveykus

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 9:58 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Anne Renc in person;
VRCW. 
PRELIMINARY HEARING:
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  Reading Waived.

PLEA HEARING:
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
 
PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 18 Months Probation. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, AODA and Follow up, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 6 Days Credit.

Adjourned: 10:10 am
